rules.6x6: Place a digit from 1 to 6 into each empty cell in the grid so that each digit appears exactly once in each row, column and 2x3 outlined box. Adjacent cells, reading left-to-right or top-to-bottom, that represent a two-digit perfect square are marked in the grid. All such perfect squares are marked. The list of perfect squares is 16, 25, 36, 49, 64 and 81.
rules.9x9: Place a digit from 1 to 9 into each empty cell in the grid so that each digit appears exactly once in each row, column and 3x3 outlined box. Adjacent cells, reading left-to-right or top-to-bottom, that represent a two-digit perfect square are marked in the grid. All such perfect squares are marked. The list of perfect squares is 16, 25, 36, 49, 64 and 81.
